meanings.definition: The quality of being deceptive or misleading.
meanings.sent1: Her delusiveness made it hard to trust her words.
meanings.sent2: The delusiveness of the magician's tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat's delusiveness about its ability to catch birds was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The delusiveness of the mirage in the desert fooled the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The delusiveness of the online advertisement left many customers disappointed.

meanings.definition: The state of holding false beliefs or illusions.
meanings.sent1: His delusiveness about his singing talent was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The patient's delusiveness about being a famous celebrity worried the doctors.
meanings.sent3: The delusiveness of the child's belief in the tooth fairy was endearing.
meanings.sent4: The delusiveness of the cult leader's promises led to the downfall of many followers.
meanings.sent5: The delusiveness of the haunted house created a spooky atmosphere for visitors.
